name: Centro Histórico de Quito
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site with colonial plazas, museums, and landmark churches.

name: La Basilica
description: The Basilica of the National Vow, located in the historic center of Quito, is the largest neo-Gothic temple in the Americas. Its construction, which began in 1892, is characterized by the replacement of traditional gargoyles with animals from Ecuadorian fauna.

name: Iglesia de San Francisco
description: 16th-century Franciscan complex featuring baroque chapels, cloisters, and a museum.

name: Iglesia de la Compañía de Jesús
description: Sumptuous baroque church known for its gilded interior crafted in gold leaf.

name: Mitad del Mundo
address: Ciudad Mitad del Mundo, San Antonio de Pichincha
description: Monument and interactive museums marking latitude 0° at the equator.

name: TelefériQo Quito
description: Cable car to Cruz Loma with city and volcano vistas; access to high-altitude trails.

name: Parque Itchimbía & Centro Cultural
description: Hillside park with the glass-and-iron Crystal Palace and sweeping views of the Old Town.

name: Parque Metropolitano Guangüiltagua
description: One of South America’s largest urban parks—running trails, picnic areas, and native forest.
